result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L Janz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: 14CF2 & 14CM14 cases called at 2:41 pm. Defendant Michael L Janz in court with attorney William R Ackell.  Steven P Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court authorizes the withdrawl of warrants previoulsy issued.  Statement by Attorney Ackell-agreement has been reached.   Resolution stated on the record by ADA Anderson. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Counts 2 & 3 of 14CF2 & 14CM14.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 1 of 2014CF2. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Ackell. Statement by defendant. Court makes a statement to the defendant prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: 14CF2- Count 2-Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 14CF2- Count 3 & 14CM14: SWD and places the defendant on probation for 2 years, consecutive to any existing sentence the defendant is currently serving. CONDITIONS: HSED, counseling of Agent, and Costs, to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Court will allow the defendant to petition the court for early termination of probation after he obtains his HSED. Appeal Rights Given.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

Case called @ 1:19 p.m. Defendant Michael L Janz in court with attorney Bryan Keberlein.  Defendant Michael L Janz in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $500 cash bond. Atty Keberlein requesting signature bond. Court orders $500 Cash Bond.   IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 21, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
